trends: There has been one other sighting in Noonday
There were no other sightings in Noonday on or around February 1st 2012
divs: Sighting DetailsI was leaving Church in Tyler, TX and made a detour to Flint, Tx to run an errand and was leaving Flint, TX on HWY 346 heading West toward Noonday,TX. I noticed a large yellow-orange orb or ball of light in the sky to the west of me as I was traveling west on HWY 346. It appeared to be hovering like a star but it was not the color of a star of planet which is a bright white color, this thing is a yellow-orange color. I watched it off and on as I was driving and would lose sight of it due to being behind trees and houses, etc. It was still in the sky to the west of me when I reached HWY 155 to turn left to go to Noonday. While in Noonday, I turned left to head towards home and saw it again in the sky straight ahead which was west and I was going west so it was straight ahead. It looked like it was still about 45-50 degrees in the sky at that time but it looked like it was going further away from my position. I went to the marina to get a better look and hopefully take a picture of it but by the time I got to the marina, the yellow-orange ball was too far away to show up in my camera. It had moved accross the lake and even further than that until it was just a little orange spec in the sky above the horizon. The sighting started while driving at around 8:20pm and continued until just after 8:30pm when I lost sight of the orange ball. It was going west when I saw it last. I am dissapointed that I didnt get any pictures this time like I did last time. The orange ball didnt linger around the lake like it did before on 01-01-12.
Summary: Yellow-orange orb/with pulsating lights hovering-moving slowly over horizon
